reviewText: I purchased this with his (Nixon) appearance on William F Buckley's "firing Line" DVD from '67 and they both make compelling viewing and somewhat bookend his Presidency so to speak. this is about a half hour interview but its no frills and Ted Koppell never minced words anyway and neither does Nixon. Recommended to historians and political junkies.

Even for when this was recorded, Nixon was spot on with most of his observations and what he thought was around the corner in the political scene.

My only complaint would be that it could be longer, but that's about it.
